page.title: 06BIOG. SHIRE HORSE BREEDER
page.content: {Bill Kitching}-Rose Farm,Moore breeds Shire Horses.His stock is 5 mares-they have no stallion.Any shoeing is done at Beeston since the village blacksmith died.Bill is taciturn.His brother Ernie provided much of this information.Both men are remarkably hard working.They started work the hard way at ages 7 and 9 when their father faced the loss of his farm due to his 'capital partner'pulling out of the business.They are never idle. Bill's aim is to beat all competitors.They sell mostly to the U.S.A. for bloodstocks.Their shires are black with white blaze and four white legs.Sometimes the American buyers want "greys".Yearlings or 2 year olds can fetch as much as Â£5000 - Â£7000.The Shire Horse Society Magazine features the Kitchings Shire Pedigree as "Moore's Gay"
